thread.title: Radio host: Time Inc. stole my name for new car or truck web-site
thread.title_full: Radio host: Time Inc. stole my name for new car or truck web-site | Breaking News & Headlines

author: Graham Finley
title: Radio host: Time Inc. stole my name for new car or truck web-site
text:
The Drive with Alan Taylor, Time Inc.’s new auto web site, has hit a speed bump.
Radio host Alan Taylor said the firm has ripped off the name from his syndicated radio show, which reaches one hundred markets. Taylor’s been undertaking his car or truck-talk show given that 1992, when he teamed up with Motor Trend, and later Auto &amp Driver, just before going back to Motor Trend.
He stated when he left Motor Trend Radio in 2013, he renamed his show “The Drive With Alan Taylor” and started functioning with Time Inc. to bring in auto ads in exchange for promotion for his show.
He worked with Newell Thompson, Time Inc.’s executive director of custom content material, and Brendan Ripp, who was at Fortune then, but has since been promoted to publisher of Sports Illustrated.
About 3 months ago, Taylor learned that Time Inc. was naming its new digital venture The Drive.
“They are literally stealing my name,” he mentioned. “They took one thing that I helped them construct, and then they kicked me out of bed.”
Taylor stated he helped them sell an insert to Jaguar and a $500,000 ad package from Maserati in SI’s 50th anniversary swimsuit edition.
“I said I would be prepared to change the name of my show in exchange for $500,000,” stated Taylor, citing a letter he sent to Time Inc.’s legal counsel, Shawn Flowers.
Time Inc. countered with an offer to spend him $1,000 a month for a year, according to Taylor.
He known as the offer you an “insult” and said he plans to file a lawsuit.
“We categorically deny that Mr. Taylor has any rights or claims related to Time Inc.’s new project or small business,” a Time Inc. spokeswoman mentioned.
